title.value: Hearing Screening Prior To Hospital Discharge

text.value: This measure assesses the proportion of births that have been screened for hearing loss before hospital discharge.

value.value: Birthing facility staff should review the effectiveness and timeliness of screening relative to nursery discharge. Benchmarks set within the EHCP may trigger hospital or jurisdictional compliance activities, such as re-writing of procedural guidelines or re-training of screening staff.
HRSA Title V Block Grant MCHB Performance Measure: Percentage of newborns who have been screened for hearing before hospital discharge.
The measurement period is one calendar year but the reporting period is jurisdictionally defined.
All live births discharged during the measurement time period born at a facility
All live births discharged during the measurement time period born at a facility
Patient deceased prior to discharge and has not received hearing screening.
All live births during the measurement time period born at a facility and screened for hearing loss prior to discharge, or not being screened due to medical reasons or medical exclusions.
For every patient evaluated by this measure also identify payer, race, ethnicity and sex.
